intro: Foleyola, commonly known as the golden bellvista, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture. Foleyola is valued not only for its ornamental appeal but also for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
